item.title: Taiwan's Strongest Earthquake In Nearly 25 Years Damages Buildings, Kills At Least 9
item.description: A strong earthquake has shaken Taiwan, damaging buildings in a southern city and creating a tsunami that washed ashore on Japanese islands.
item.content:encoded: A strong earthquake has shaken Taiwan, damaging buildings in a southern city and creating a tsunami that washed ashore on Japanese islands.

item.title: Tehran Vows Response After Strike Blamed On Israel Destroyed Iran's Consulate In Syria And Killed 12
item.description: A deadly airstrike, widely attributed to Israel, demolished Iran’s consulate building in the Syrian capital and killed 12 people, including two Iranian generals.
item.content:encoded: A deadly airstrike, widely attributed to Israel, demolished Iran’s consulate building in the Syrian capital and killed 12 people, including two Iranian generals.

item.title: Aid Groups Suspend Operations In Gaza After Israeli Airstrikes Kill World Central Kitchen Workers
item.description: The nonprofits, including World Central Kitchen, said they now need to determine whether their workers can safely provide aid in the region.
item.content:encoded: The nonprofits, including World Central Kitchen, said they now need to determine whether their workers can safely provide aid in the region.

item.title: Japan's Royal Family Makes Formal Debut On Instagram
item.description: The Japanese imperial family's social media debut comes 15 years after Britain’s royal family joined Twitter in 2009.
item.content:encoded: The Japanese imperial family's social media debut comes 15 years after Britain’s royal family joined Twitter in 2009.

item.title: 12-Year-Old Student Opens Fire At School In Finland, Killing 1 and Wounding 2
item.description: Police in Finland say a 12-year-old student has opened fire at a secondary school in southern Finland and wounded three other students.
item.content:encoded: Police in Finland say a 12-year-old student has opened fire at a secondary school in southern Finland and wounded three other students.

item.title: Israel Killed 2 Generals And 5 Others In Airstrike On Iran's Consulate In Syria, Iran Says
item.description: The airstrike in Syria killed Gen. Mohammad Reza Zahedi, who led the elite Quds Force in Lebanon and Syria until 2016, according to Iran's Revolutionary Guard.
item.content:encoded: The airstrike in Syria killed Gen. Mohammad Reza Zahedi, who led the elite Quds Force in Lebanon and Syria until 2016, according to Iran's Revolutionary Guard.

item.title: U.S. And Israel To Hold Virtual Talks Over Dispute On Possible Rafah Invasion
item.description: Officials from both countries will discuss Israel's plan to launch a ground offensive in the southern Gaza city, which houses over 1.3 million Palestinians.
item.content:encoded: Officials from both countries will discuss Israel's plan to launch a ground offensive in the southern Gaza city, which houses over 1.3 million Palestinians.

item.title: Aid Group Says Israeli Strike Kills 7 Workers In Gaza, Including Foreigners
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said an "unintended strike" killed the World Central Kitchen aid workers.
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said an "unintended strike" killed the World Central Kitchen aid workers.

item.title: In Setback To Turkey's Erdogan, Opposition Makes Huge Gains In Local Election
item.description: Turkey's main opposition party has retained its control over key cities and made huge gains in local elections.
item.content:encoded: Turkey's main opposition party has retained its control over key cities and made huge gains in local elections.

item.title: Israelis Stage Largest Protest Since War Began To Increase Pressure On Netanyahu
item.description: Nearly six months of conflict have renewed divisions over the leadership of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, though the country remains largely in favor of the war.
item.content:encoded: Nearly six months of conflict have renewed divisions over the leadership of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, though the country remains largely in favor of the war.

item.title: Royal Family Puts On United Front At Easter Following Kate, Charles’ Cancer Diagnoses
item.description: The royal appearance comes a little over a week after the Princess of Wales revealed she'd been diagnosed with cancer.
item.content:encoded: The royal appearance comes a little over a week after the Princess of Wales revealed she'd been diagnosed with cancer.
